page.title: 07Energy in Caerhun Parish
page.content: The main energy source is electricity, supplied to the local community through the National Grid network system. There is no local gas supply but individual homes may use coal, oil or calor gas as other energy sources. A major gas pipeline runs through the area to serve major towns such as Bangor further west. Several lines of electricity pylons from the Wylfa nuclear power station on Anglesey climb over Bwlch-y-Ddeufaen and spread out to either end of the Conwy Valley. Around Penygadair is a well-constructed leet built in the 1920s with good concrete walls and base to run the hill water to the reservoirs serving the hydro-electric generating station at Dolgarrog. This leet is no longer in use.
